name: Kepler-313
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-313 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-313 is a star with 1.9999999999999991 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.54 times its radius. It is located 3520.53 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-313 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-313 b

Kepler-313 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 14.97 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-313.

The mass of Kepler-313 b is 8.95 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-313 b is 2.53 that of Earth. At 8.95 Earth masses, Kepler-313 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-313 c

Kepler-313 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 32.27 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-313.

The mass of Kepler-313 c is 9.24 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-313 c is 2.57 that of Earth. At 9.24 Earth masses, Kepler-313 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-313, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
